item.title: 波动加剧，台币创五月以来最大涨幅
item.description: 在台币波动的又一个交易日中，台币大涨超过 2%，因为交易员们在测试央行对台币走强的容忍度。【原文：The Taiwan’s dollar surged more than 2% in another day of volatility for the currency, as traders test the central bank’s tolerance for its strength.】

item.title: 国内需求拉动新加坡房价第三季度上涨
item.description: 受本地需求提振，新加坡私人住宅价格连续第三个季度上涨。【原文：Singapore private home prices rose for a third straight quarter, buoyed by local demand.】

item.title: 受美国降息押注和美元疲软影响，黄金走高
item.description: 黄金连续第二天上涨，原因是市场乐观地认为美联储将在今年晚些时候恢复降息，同时投资者继续关注美国在7月9日关税截止日期前的贸易谈判。【原文：Gold rose for a second day on optimism the Federal Reserve will resume rate cuts later this year, while investors continued to monitor US trade talks ahead of a July 9 US tariff deadline.】

item.title: 达里奥呼吁两党解决美国 "债务炸弹 "问题
item.description: 布里奇沃特联合公司（Bridgewater Associates）创始人雷-达里奥（Ray Dalio）在 X 网站的一篇文章中写道，除非两党同时增加税收和减少支出，否则美国的 "赤字/债务炸弹 "问题是无法持续解决的。【原文：There is no way that the US “deficit/debt bomb” problem can be sustainably dealt with unless there is a bipartisan mix of tax revenue increases and spending decreases, Bridgewater Associates founder Ray Dalio wrote in a post on X.】

item.title: 第一生命和丸红计划持有 210 亿美元的房地产资产
item.description: 第一生命控股公司（Dai-ichi Life Holdings Inc.【原文：Dai-ichi Life Holdings Inc. said that it aims to hold ¥3 trillion ($21 billion) in real estate assets with Marubeni Corp. by the fiscal year starting April 2030 through the integration of their property businesses, making it among Japan’s biggest investors in the sector.】

item.title: 美国七月贸易截止日期前韩国出口反弹
item.description: 韩国 6 月份出口反弹，为依赖贸易的韩国经济带来短暂提振，因为在对运往美国的商品征收广泛关税之前，企业加快了发货速度。【原文：South Korea’s exports rebounded in June, providing a brief boost to the trade-dependent economy as companies accelerated shipments before broad duties on goods shipped to the US are set to rise.】

item.title: 韩国财富基金将加大对人工智能初创企业的投资，并将目光投向中国科技企业
item.description: 韩国主权财富基金计划增加对科技初创企业和风险投资基金的拨款，这是该基金深化人工智能和其他颠覆性技术投资的更广泛努力的一部分。【原文：South Korea’s sovereign wealth fund plans to increase allocations to tech startups and venture capital funds as part of its broader push to deepen exposure to artificial intelligence and other disruptive technologies.】

item.title: 尽管加征关税，日本商业景气指数仍高于共识
item.description: 6 月份，日本大型制造商的信心有所增强，这反映出他们在面对美国不断升级的关税行动时表现出的韧性，也为日本央行在未来几个月再次加息提供了支持。【原文：Confidence among Japan’s large manufacturers edged up in June, reflecting resilience in the face of the escalating US tariff campaign and backing the case for another Bank of Japan interest rate hike in coming months.】

item.title: 保险公司 Accelerant 申请 IPO，披露销售额不断增长
item.description: Accelerant Holdings 申请首次公开募股，加入了美国保险业的上市热潮。【原文：Accelerant Holdings filed for an initial public offering, joining a rush of insurance-related listings in the US.】

item.title: 尽管贸易条件疲软，新西兰企业仍保持乐观
item.description: 新西兰经济研究所（New Zealand Institute of Economic Research）的数据显示，尽管新西兰企业自身的贸易仍然低迷，但他们对第二季度的前景更加乐观。【原文：New Zealand businesses were more upbeat about the future in the second quarter even as their own trading remained sluggish, according to the New Zealand Institute of Economic Research.】

item.title: 税费和食品成本上升导致超市价格上涨
item.description: 英国商店价格近一年来首次上涨，超市尤其受到税收和批发成本上升的影响。【原文：UK shop prices rose for the first time in almost a year, with supermarkets in particular hurt by higher taxes and wholesale costs.】

item.title: 台湾寿险公司因高昂的外汇套期保值成本而进退两难
item.description: 台湾的人寿保险公司在 5 月份当地美元飙升时被打了个措手不及，有迹象表明他们的痛苦才刚刚开始。【原文：Taiwan’s life insurers were caught flat-footed when the local dollar surged in May, and there are signs to suggest their pain has only just begun.】

item.title: 欧元兑人民币汇率创 2014 年以来最强，涨势仍在继续
item.description: 受持续流入欧洲市场的资本推动，欧元兑人民币汇率升至十多年来的最强水平。【原文：The euro rallied to its strongest against the Chinese yuan in over a decade, buoyed by sustained capital inflows into the European market.】

item.title: 石油保持跌势，关注欧佩克+增产规模
item.description: 石油维持近期跌势，市场关注欧佩克+将在周日的会议上增加多少产量。【原文：Oil held recent declines with the focus on how much OPEC+ will increase production at a meeting on Sunday.】

item.title: 关税忧虑挥之不去，亚洲开盘谨慎观望：市场综述
item.description: 亚洲股市准备谨慎开盘，因为投资者在权衡华尔街的欣欣向荣与对唐纳德-特朗普总统的关税议程对全球影响的挥之不去的忧虑。【原文：Asian stocks are poised for a cautious open as investors weigh the buoyant mood on Wall Street with lingering concerns over the global impact of President Donald Trump’s tariff agenda.】

item.title: 美国国债获得韩国财富基金的信任票
item.description: 韩国 2,065 亿美元的主权财富基金不受近期市场波动的影响，继续将美国国债作为核心资产。【原文：South Korea’s $206.5 billion sovereign wealth fund is standing by US Treasuries as a core holding, undeterred by recent market volatility.】

item.title: 陷入困境的半导体公司 Wolfspeed 申请破产
item.description: 在唐纳德-特朗普总统重塑拜登时代科技补贴的推动下，芯片制造商 Wolfspeed Inc.【原文：Wolfspeed Inc., a chipmaker caught in President Donald Trump’s push to reshape Biden-era tech subsidies, filed bankruptcy to enact a creditor-backed plan to slash $4.6 billion in debt.】

item.title: 美元指数暴跌 10.8%，创 1973 年以来最大上半年跌幅
item.description: 今年上半年，美元指数暴跌，创下了自 1973 年理查德-尼克松担任总统以来最差的上半年表现。【原文：The US dollar index tumbled in the first six months of the year, posting its worst first-half performance since 1973 when Richard Nixon was president.】

item.title: 美国计划增加对意大利的大豆出口并组建新的工作组
item.description: 美国农业部长布鲁克-罗林斯（Brooke Rollins）周一在与意大利农业部长会晤后告诉记者，意大利将增加对美国大豆的进口，作为重新平衡两国贸易的新努力的一部分。【原文：Italy will increase its imports of US soybeans as part of a new effort to rebalance trade between the two countries, US Agriculture Secretary Brooke Rollins told reporters Monday after meeting with her Italian counterpart.】

item.title: 美国将分阶段恢复墨西哥牲畜进口
item.description: 美国将开始分阶段重新向墨西哥牲畜开放港口，此前，南部边境贸易曾因寄生虫苍蝇的传播而于 5 月份中断。【原文：The US will start reopening ports to Mexican livestock in phases, after trade along the southern border had been halted in May by the spread of a parasitic fly.】

item.title: 美国财政部的三起黑客事件暴露了令银行紧张的模式
item.description:
彭博新闻社调查发现，在三起重大黑客攻击事件中，财政部没有部署本可防止攻击或及早发现入侵者的网络安全措施。【原文：

In three major hacks, Treasury didn’t deploy cybersecurity measures that could have prevented the attacks or flagged the intruders sooner, a Bloomberg News investigation found.

】

item.title: 微软销售主管将休假，裁员迫在眉睫
item.description: 微软公司（Microsoft Corp. ）的最高销售主管正计划休假两个月，此举与该公司预计将出现的解雇潮不谋而合。【原文：Microsoft Corp.’s top sales executive is planning to take a two-month sabbatical, a move that coincides with an expected wave of terminations targeting his organization.】

item.title: 私人借贷者为陷入困境的托盘公司提出重组建议
item.description: 据知情人士透露，在 Summit Partners 公司收购 48Forty Solutions 公司多数股权不到一年之后，私人贷款机构提出了对 48Forty Solutions 公司进行潜在债务重组的建议。【原文：Private lenders have proposed a potential debt restructuring for 48Forty Solutions, less than a year after Summit Partners acquired a majority stake in the pallet management company, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 墨西哥金融科技公司 Klar 以 8 亿美元估值融资 1.9 亿美元
item.description: 墨西哥金融科技公司 Klar 表示，该公司已通过 C 轮融资筹集到 1.9 亿美元，领投方为美国私募股权公司 General Atlantic，公司估值超过 8 亿美元。【原文：Mexican fintech Klar said it has raised $190 million through a Series C funding round, led by US private equity firm General Atlantic, that valued the company at more than $800 million.】

item.title: 派拉蒙与特朗普确认和解谈判，推迟法庭诉讼
item.description: 派拉蒙全球公司正在就解决美国总统唐纳德-特朗普提起的诉讼进行深入谈判，特朗普指控该公司旗下的哥伦比亚广播公司网络对时任副总统卡马拉-哈里斯（Kamala Harris）的《60 分钟》采访进行了欺骗性编辑。【原文：Paramount Global is in advanced talks to settle a lawsuit filed by US President Donald Trump that alleges the company’s CBS network deceptively edited a 60 Minutes interview with then-Vice President Kamala Harris.】

item.title: 加密 ETF 之夏 "以区块链驱动的新交易拉开帷幕
item.description: 随着特朗普政府放松对数字资产行业的监管，华尔街即将首次尝到新型加密货币产品的甜头。【原文：Wall Street is about to get its first taste of a new kind of cryptocurrency product as the Trump administration eases the regulatory grip on the digital-asset industry.】

item.title: 特朗普引用的 TikTok 买家与之前的投资者集团相同
item.description: 据一位熟悉内情的人士透露，唐纳德-特朗普总统提到的 TikTok 美国业务的潜在买家正是包括甲骨文公司、黑石集团和风险投资公司 Andreessen Horowitz 在内的投资财团。【原文：The prospective buyer of TikTok’s American operations cited by President Donald Trump is the same investor consortium including Oracle Corp., Blackstone Inc. and venture capital firm Andreessen Horowitz, whose bid for the app had stalled amid US-China trade tensions, according to a person familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 纽约市 5,000 多套租金稳定的公寓面临资金紧张问题
item.description: 联邦法官驳回了房东乔尔-维纳（Joel Wiener）提出的动用其主要贷款人旗星银行（Flagstar Bank）收入的请求，使其在纽约市拥有的数千套租金稳定公寓的维护资金陷入困境。【原文：Funding to maintain thousands of rent-stabilized apartments in New York City owned by landlord Joel Wiener is in limbo after a federal judge denied a request to tap income belonging to its major lender, Flagstar Bank.】

item.title: 米莱解除外汇管制后，阿根廷经济增长超出预期
item.description: 作为与国际货币基金组织达成的 200 亿美元协议的一部分，哈维尔-米莱总统放松了部分货币管制，因此阿根廷 4 月份的经济增长超过预期。【原文：Argentina’s economy grew more than expected in April as President Javier Milei loosened some currency controls as part of a $20 billion agreement with the International Monetary Fund.】

item.title: 拉加德称欧洲央行策略调整有助于避免 "虚假确定性
item.description: 欧洲央行行长克里斯蒂娜-拉加德（Christine Lagarde）表示，周一公布的欧洲央行战略调整将使政策制定者能够在一个越来越难以预测的世界中提供更加细致入微的沟通。【原文：Tweaks to the European Central Bank’s strategy unveiled Monday will allow policymakers to deliver more nuanced communication in an increasing unpredictable world, President Christine Lagarde said.】
